definition: to regard as important/to care about
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
heavy/serious/to attach importance to
to repeat/repetition/again/re-/classifier: layer

sentences.english: The Chinese values the happy cheerful atmosphere that the family when spending the New Year reunites very much.
sentences.chinese: 中國人非常看重過年時全家團聚的喜樂氣氛。

sentences.english: We generally tend to overvalue the present profit and undervalue the environment.
sentences.chinese: 我們往往看重目前的利益而忽略了環境。

sentences.english: But if you just value money than your opinion is worthless.
sentences.chinese: 但如果你只看重錢，你的觀點分文不值。

sentences.english: It used to be that packaging and convenience were all the rage.
sentences.chinese: 在過去，人們看重的僅僅是食品的包裝和方便程度。

sentences.english: If you bungle raising your children, I don't think whatever else you do matters very much.
sentences.chinese: 要是你養不好孩子，我想其它的事情你也不會很看重。

sentences.english: And then, going back to the first question that you ask me, what's the thing that I measure the most?
sentences.chinese: 回到你問的第一個問題，我看重的衡量標準是什麼？

sentences.english: He valued prayer enough to spend many hours at the task.
sentences.chinese: 正因爲耶穌看重禱告，所以纔會花這麼多時間禱告。

sentences.english: We take too much upon ourselves if we believe that, Simplicio.
sentences.chinese: 辛普利西若是相信此說人類未免也太看重自己了。

sentences.english: We also over-extrapolate the recent past.
sentences.chinese: 我們還過度看重了近期走勢。

sentences.english: Pastors have neglected their rightful oversight of worship, including the doctrinal content of the music.
sentences.chinese: 牧者們也已經在敬拜，聖樂神學內容上不看重了。

sentences.english: Highlight your strengths, and what is most relevant to the potential employer.
sentences.chinese: 儘量強調你的優勢以及潛在僱主最看重的那些方面。

sentences.english: Instead, they look at the lifetime value of the customer.
sentences.chinese: 與此相反，他們看重的是顧客的生命週期價值。

sentences.english: Being laid back will show everyone that you value yourself and that is sexy.
sentences.chinese: 隨和一些會告訴別人你很看重自己，這是性感。

sentences.english: W2: Chinese value family and education more than Americans.
sentences.chinese: 中國人比美國人更看重家庭和教育。

sentences.english: Lord, forgive our carefree attitudes toward worship.
sentences.chinese: 主啊，我們不看重敬拜，求禰赦免。

sentences.english: Thus, while the U. S. might value extraverts, other cultures value introverted personality.
sentences.chinese: 因此，美國較看重外向者，而其他文化則重視內向的。

definition: to have a preference for/to fancy/to choose after consideration/to settle on
to attach importance to sth/to value
to care about/equivalent of 在於|在于[zai4 yu2]
to care about/to mind
to pay attention to/to emphasize
to rely heavily upon
to consider/to give serious consideration to sth/consideration
to stand out/outstanding
to esteem/to think highly of/to accord importance to/to revere
to incline to/to prefer/to be prone to
carefully/meticulously/to set one's heart on sth
(lit.) to fix one's gaze on/(fig.) to show interest in/(favorable) attention/favor
to be concerned about/to care about
moreover/besides
to approve of/to endorse/to acknowledge/to recognize/to identify oneself with
to approve/approval/acknowledgment/OK
